page.title: 16INGLEBY VILLAGE
page.content: Ingleby village is really a hamlet as it only has fifteen houses,three farms,and a public house.The people who live there either work in the village,in farming or the pub,"The John Thompson",commute or are retired.The village has no centre,being situated along a country road.there is no church,although there was once a chapel for the farm workers.The property in the village is very popular because it is so close to Derby,and so is very expensive.The village is on rich soil just above the flood plain of the river Trent.The fields tend to be used main ly for grazing,because of the risk of floods.There are no modern buildings in Ingleby,although the public house, which brews its own beer,and is named after its landlord,has been extended.
